title: Virtual office hour with USPTO patent examiners
description: Calling all scientists and engineers!Seeking a career at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner? If you are a U.S. citizen and are graduating this year with a focus in…BiologyBiomedical EngineeringChemistryChemical EngineeringComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceDesignElectrical EngineeringMechanical EngineeringPhysics …then bring your questions about the agency, the role, and the hiring process to this informal Q&A session with current USPTO patent examiners on March 6, at noon ET. Our team members are excited to answer your questions, chat with you, and provide you with more information about this opportunity. Join sessionYou do not need to register for this event but come prepared with any questions you may have. We hope to see you there! For more information, contact recruitment@uspto.gov. When you are ready to apply, submit your application via USAJOBS.

title: The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
description: Are you an inventor? Join us for this session full of important tips on filing a patent application and what to do after you file for a patent.In the final part of this eight-part recurring series, you will learn about common mistakes to avoid, and you'll gain a better understanding of post-filing procedures and support. Register todayFor more information, please email SiliconValley@uspto.gov or RockyMountain@uspto.gov.

title: Fundamentos de la propiedad intelectual
description: ¿Desea familiarizarse con las patentes, las marcas registradas, los derechos de autor y los secretos comerciales? De ser así, le invitamos a una sesión virtual gratuita acerca de los fundamentos de la propiedad intelectual y las formas potenciales de proteger sus innovaciones mientras transforma su idea en un producto. Esta sesión abordará los siguientes temas:Información acerca de la Oficina de Patentes y Marcas de los EE. UU. (USPTO, por sus siglas en inglés)Los tipos de propiedad intelectual: patentes, marcas registradas, derechos de autor y secretos comercialesPor qué los innovadores y emprendedores deben proteger su propiedad intelectualCómo proteger su propiedad intelectualRegístrese hoyPara obtener más información, envíe un correo electrónico a EasternRegionalOutreachOffice@USPTO.gov.

title: National Medal of Technology and Innovation Webinar 2024
description: The National Medal of Technology and Innovation (NMTI) is America’s highest honor for technological achievement and innovation. The president of the United States presents the NMTI at a special White House ceremony.

title: Fundamentos básicos de las patentes
description: ¿Le interesa aprender acerca de los fundamentos de la propiedad intelectual y las patentes? Le invitamos a una sesión virtual gratuita en la que exploraremos los diferentes tipos de patentes, incluyendo patentes de utilidad, de diseño y de plantas. Además, expertos de la Oficina de Patentes y Marcas de EE. UU. (USPTO, por sus siglas en inglés) explicarán la diferencia entre las solicitudes de patentes provisionales y las no provisionales, y cómo utilizarlas.Los asistentes también aprenderán acerca de: El proceso de tramitación de patentesLa función de los examinadores de patentes de la USPTOQué esperar al trabajar con la USPTO para obtener una patenteRecursos disponibles a través de la USPTO para proteger su propiedad intelectualRegístrese hoyPara aprender más, por favor visite la página de Fundamentos de patentes de la USPTO. Para obtener más información acerca de este evento, escriba a EasternRegionalOutreachOffice@uspto.gov.
subject: Alexandria VA (Headquarters), Dallas, Denver, Silicon Valley, Detroit

title: Formerly Incarcerated Innovation and Entrepreneurship program: Overcoming challenge with innovation
subject: Inventor Resources, Trademarks, Office Locations

title: One-day trademarks boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on March 14, 2024 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET at UMES Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation in Princess Anne, Maryland. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.The event explores what trademarks are, the benefits of federal trademark registration, and the basics of the registration process. We’ll also discuss why it’s so important for any new business to select a trademark that is both federally registrable and legally protectable.Topics will include:Fundamentals and searchingApplications and filingResponses and registrationThere will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event, or the One-day patents and trademarks boot camp series, please email Andriae.Holt@uspto.gov.
subject: Patents, SOAR, Training

title: Attend DOCX filing training
description: Join us March 14, 2-3 p.m. ET (online) to learn how to file patent-related documents in DOCX format using Patent Center. You will hear from experts on the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) eCommerce Modernization (eMod) team, who will provide demonstrations and answer your questions. This session is one of several free training sessions found on the DOCX filing series page.Instructions for joining the Webex training session will be provided via email to each registrant.DOCX is a word processing file format based on open standards and is supported by many popular word processing applications. As an open standard format, DOCX offers a safe and stable basis for authoring and processing intellectual property documents. Learn more about filing in DOCX in this hour-long session.We encourage you to explore DOCX filing using the Patent Center training mode at any time. Training mode does not save or store data in USPTO systems.Register todayFor more information, please contact eMod@uspto.gov. To provide feedback, please visit the eMod IdeaScale.
subject: Patent Center

title: Fundamentos básicos de las marcas registradas
description: ¿Es usted un emprendedor o propietario de un negocio pequeño? ¿Tiene un nombre o logotipo que usa para promover o anunciar su negocio?Acompañe a los expertos de la Oficina de Patentes y Marcas de EE. UU. (USPTO, por sus siglas en inglés) en una sesión informativa en la que exploraremos los diferentes tipos de marcas registradas, incluyendo nombres de las marcas, diseños, logotipos e imágenes comerciales.También se discutirá:Cómo usar nuestra base de datos para encontrar marcas que podrían confligir con la suyaCómo elegir marcas registradas distintivas Los pasos para presentar una solicitud de marca registradaLas tarifas para presentar una solicitud y mantener una marca registradaRegístrese hoyPara aprender más, visite nuestra página de Fundamentos de las marcas registradas.Para obtener más información, escriba a EasternRegionalOutreachOffice@USPTO.gov.
subject: Alexandria VA (Headquarters), Dallas, Denver, Silicon Valley, Detroit

title: Aprenda cómo proteger su tecnología en el extranjero
description: ¿Sabía que hay maneras de proteger su patente en otro país?Si desea saber cómo presentar solicitudes de patentes en jurisdicciones extranjeras, le invitamos a esta sesión gratuita que ofrecerán los expertos de la Oficina de Patentes y Marcas de EE.UU. (USPTO, por sus siglas en inglés). Se discutirán temas como:Las opciones para ayudar a proteger su propiedad intelectual en jurisdicciones extranjerasUna descripción general del Tratado de Cooperación en materia de Patentes (PCT, por sus siglas en inglés)El uso del Convenio de París para países que no están afiliados al PCTRegístrese hoyPara aprender más, visite la página sobre el Tratado de Cooperación en materia de Patentes en nuestra página web.Para obtener más información sobre este evento, escriba a EasternRegionalOutreachOffice@USPTO.gov.

title: Patents for librarians
description: Are you a librarian looking for a better understanding of patent concepts? Do you want to be able to share reliable resources with inventors looking to protect their intellectual property? The United States Patent and Trademark Office's Patent and Trademark Resource Center Program is offering a new webinar that introduces patent concepts and resources for professional librarians and library staff. This webinar will cover: An overview of patent concepts Types of patents Parts of a patent Steps to apply for a patent Patent and Trademark Resource Centers (PTRCs) and how they can help Additional resources Please register to attend this free virtual webinar, which will be held on Tuesday, March 19, from 2-3 p.m. E.T. Register todayFor more information, email PTRCP@uspto.gov.Accessibility
subject: Patents

title: Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?Get a head StART with this free, virtual three-day workshop that focuses on helping participants learn the fundamentals of the patent application process. The Stakeholder Application Readiness Training (StART) is for independent inventors, entrepreneurs, and anyone working for or with a small business who want to file patent applications without the assistance of a registered patent agent or attorney.Patent protection is critical to:Safeguarding products and services from imitationAttracting and securing funding from outside investorsPromoting the overall commercial success of any enterpriseThe StART program is one of many initiatives and activities that form part of the USPTO’s mission. Participants of the StART three-day workshop will receive training from experts on:Types of patent applicationsPrior art searchesScope of claimsFormality requirementsClaim writing and claim draftingProper application forms (provisional, design, and non-provisional)Application data sheetPatent CenterDOCX filesParticipants may also choose to participate in one-on-one assistance breakout room discussions.Complete interest formInstructions for joining the training session are provided via email to each registrant. For more information, email setd@uspto.gov.
subject: Patents, START, About Us, Education

title: Getting started with Patent Public Search
description: Are you puzzled by patent searching or confused by the patent searching options available on the internet? Whether you are a novice searcher or an experienced one, the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is here to help.  Librarians from the Patent and Trademark Resource Center Program, who are experienced with educating users on USPTO search tools, will show you how to use the new Patent Public Search tool. The virtual webinar will be held on Thursday, March 21, from 2-3 p.m. ET.Register todayFor more information pertaining to this webinar, please email PTRCP@uspto.gov.Accessibility

title: SOaR presents -- How to use Patent Public Search tool (PPUBS) to search like an examiner
description: Are you interested in learning how to use the Patent Public Search tool (PPUBS) to search like an examiner? If so, Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) has the training for you. On Tuesday, March 26, at 1 p.m. ET, SOaR will provide virtual training on how to use PPUBS, with live search demonstrations from an expert who will highlight techniques examiners use.Register todayThe PPUBS training will include:How to use PPUBS How examiners search Live search examplesThis training event is free to the public, however, preregistration is required. Once registered, you will receive instructions for joining the webinar via email.For more information on SOaR trainings, email SOaR@uspto.gov. Captioning service will be provided.
subject: Patents, SOAR

title: Learn how to conduct a patent search at the USPTO Texas Regional Office
description: Are you interested in learning more about patent searching?Register today to attend this in-person, interactive session on March 26 from 10-11:30 a.m. CT, led by United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts who will demonstrate how to conduct a patent search using the Patent Public Search tool.Participants will learn basic information about:How to conduct a preliminary U.S. patent searchThe six-step patentability search strategyPatent searching toolsThis new web-based patent search tool replaces legacy search tools Public-Examiner’s Automated Search Tool (PubEast), Public-Web-based Examiner’s Search Tool (PubWest), Patent Full-Text and Image Database (PatFT), and Patent Application Full-Text and Image Database (AppFT), which were retired in September 2022.Register TodayFor more information about patent searching, visit the search for patents page on the USPTO website.For questions about this event, email the USPTO's Texas Regional Office at TexasRegionalOffice@uspto.gov or call 469-295-9000. Please feel free to bring your laptop and follow along. This event is strictly in-person and will not provide a virtual component.
subject: Search, Dallas

title: Public Symposium on AI and IP
subject: Initiatives

title: PTAB Inventor Hour – Episode 26
description: Are you an inventor, entrepreneur, new practitioner, or someone who wants to learn more about the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB)? Join us Thursday, March 28 at noon ET for the next PTAB Inventor Hour webinar, Episode 26. This episode will feature an interview with a special guest, Jacqueline Bonilla, Deputy Chief Administrative Judge of the PTAB & Senior Legal Advisor to the Director of the USPTO.Episode 26 will also feature:A review of a PTAB Case File (Ex parte Albritton, Appeal No. 2008-005023), including practice tips to help you succeed in ex parte appealsA showcase of an inventor in history: Maria BeasleyA question-and-answer session will follow the presentation. Please send questions before or during the webinar to PTABInventorHour@uspto.gov.Register here
subject: Patent Trial and Appeal Board

title: USPTO PTAB/TTAB Stadium Tour – Live at Southern University
description: Are you a patent or trademark attorney who appears before the Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) and/or the Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB)? Are you interested in learning about intellectual property law or practicing before the PTAB or TTAB? If so, you should join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and Southern University for an in-person PTAB/TTAB proceeding on March 28 from 10 a.m. to 7 p.m. CT at Southern University in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.Practitioners and students will have the opportunity to:Observe judges and counsel in action during the PTAB and TTAB proceedings.Attend a fireside chat with Derrick Brent, Deputy Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Deputy Director of the USPTO.Learn about the structure and format of PTAB proceedings and TTAB opposition proceedings.Join a networking reception after the proceedings and educational sessions.The program is free, but space is limited. We encourage you to register. If you have questions, email Marina A. Biragova, Director for Intellectual Property & Business Programs at SULC at MBiragova@sulc.edu.Presentation
subject: Patent Trial and Appeal Board, Trademark Trial and Appeal Board (TTAB)

title: A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a ﬂexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields?	Biology	Biomedical Engineering	Chemistry	Chemical Engineering	Computer Engineering	Computer Science	Design	Electrical Engineering	Mechanical Engineering	Physics 	If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America’s Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on March 28 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.

title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 1: Fundamentals
description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this first module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we’ll focus on trademark protection in the United States. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.This module will cover the following topics:Definitions and types of trademarksBenefits of federal registrationSelecting a trademarkFiling and registrationFinding help This module will be presented live via Webex from 2-3:30 p.m. ET on Tuesday, April 2, 2024, and will conclude with a question-and-answer session. Please register by April 1. Register todayBe sure to check out our other boot camp modules running consecutively every week for the eight-week duration. You can attend the whole series or just the specific modules that best meet your needs. Separate registration is required for each module. After each event, we'll email registrants links to a video recording of the module and a PDF of the presentation materials. You will only receive access to the recording if you are signed up for that module.For questions about the event or the boot camp series, please contact TMWebinar@uspto.gov.
subject: Trademarks, Basic Facts, Education, Atlantic, Alexandria VA (Headquarters), Dallas, Denver, Silicon Valley, Detroit

title: One-day patents boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on April 4, 2024 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT at WKU Innovation Campus in Bowling Green, KY.   This in-person, single-day workshop is for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process.The event provides a scaffolded approach to understanding patents and intellectual property (IP) rights, the importance of claims in a patent application, and the various patent application requirements. It also includes:How to search prior artHow to properly draft claims Understanding the application formsHow to use Patent Center to file electronicallyThere will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event or the One-day patent and trademark boot camp series, please email Andriae.Holt@uspto.gov.
subject: Patents, SOAR, Training

title: Ex Parte Appeal Roadshows - Indianapolis, Indiana
description: Are you a Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) practitioner? Would you like to learn more about ex parte appeal proceedings directly from PTAB judges? Attend an Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow.The PTAB is holding in-person training focusing on best practices to succeed in an appeal on Thursday, April 4, at the Indianapolis Central Library from 1-5 p.m. ET. PTAB judges will teach all sessions. Topics include:Tips to file an appeal brief efficientlyHow to make written arguments more persuasiveHow to present an effective oral argument before a judge panelSee the agenda for more information. The event is free and registration is encouraged. The Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow will also take place in Los Angeles, Austin, Atlanta, and Philadelphia. See the full schedule for dates. If you have any questions regarding this event, please email PTABEvents@uspto.gov.CLE credit is pending per state for each roadshow location.

title: A fireside chat with USPTO patent examiners
description: Come join us for a laid back and informational fireside chat that will give you an inside look at being a patent examiner at the USPTO. You will get the opportunity to engage in insightful conversations and get answers to your questions directly from team members.
subject: Events

title: One-day patents boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on April 18, 2024 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET at the Summit Station at Innovation Center in Frostburg, Maryland. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process.The event provides a scaffolded approach to understanding patents and intellectual property (IP) rights, the importance of claims in a patent application, and the various patent application requirements. It also includes:How to search prior artHow to properly draft claims Understanding the application formsHow to use Patent Center to file electronicallyThere will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event or the One-day patent and trademark boot camp series, please email Andriae.Holt@uspto.gov.
subject: Patents, SOAR, Training

title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 4: Application requirements
description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this fourth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we’ll focus on the requirements for an initial trademark application. Knowing what is needed up front will help your filing process go more smoothly. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.This module will cover the following topics:Trademark basicsDrawingsIdentifications of goods and servicesFiling basesSpecimens and ornamentationFinding helpThis module will be presented live via Webex from 2-3:30 p.m. ET on Tuesday, April 23, 2024, and will conclude with a question-and-answer session. Please register by April 22. Register todayBe sure to check out our other boot camp modules running consecutively every week for the eight-week duration. You can attend the whole series or just the specific modules that best meet your needs. Separate registration is required for each module. After each event, we'll email registrants links to a video recording of the module and a PDF of the presentation materials. You will only receive access to the recording if you are signed up for that module.For questions about the event or the boot camp series, please contact TMWebinar@uspto.gov.
subject: Trademarks, Basic Facts, Education, Atlantic, Alexandria VA (Headquarters), Dallas, Denver, Silicon Valley, Detroit

title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 5: Application filing walk-through
description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this fifth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we’ll focus on the USPTO’s Trademark Electronic Application System (TEAS), including a live demonstration of a trademark filing. TEAS is the required system for making any trademark submission to the USPTO. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.This module will cover the following topics:Trademark basicsTEAS basicsTEAS pre-filing checklistTEAS Plus demonstrationFinding helpThis module will be presented live via Webex from 2-3:30 p.m. ET on Tuesday, April 30, 2024, and will conclude with a question-and-answer session. Please register by April 29.Register todayBe sure to check out our other boot camp modules running consecutively every week for the eight-week duration. You can attend the whole series or just the specific modules that best meet your needs. Separate registration is required for each module. After each event, we'll email registrants links to a video recording of the module and a PDF of the presentation materials. You will only receive access to the recording if you are signed up for that module.For questions about the event or the boot camp series, please contact TMWebinar@uspto.gov.

title: Trademark basics: Learn the fundamentals

title: One-day trademarks boot camp
description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on May 2, 2024 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. ET at the Summit Station at Innovation Center in Frostburg, Maryland. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.The event explores what trademarks are, the benefits of federal trademark registration, and the basics of the registration process. We’ll also discuss why it’s so important for any new business to select a trademark that is both federally registrable and legally protectable.Topics will include:Fundamentals and searchingApplications and filingResponses and registrationThere will be plenty of question-and-answer sessions throughout the day, plus a discussion about free resources available through the USPTO. This event is free, but registration is required. For registration information, questions about the one-day event, or the One-day patents and trademarks boot camp series, please email Andriae.Holt@uspto.gov.
subject: Patents, SOAR, Training

title: Ex Parte Appeal Roadshows - Philadelphia
description: Are you a Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) practitioner? Would you like to learn more about ex parte appeal proceedings directly from PTAB judges? Attend an Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow.The PTAB is holding in-person training focusing on best practices to succeed in an appeal on Thursday, May 2, at the Free Library of Philadelphia from 1-5 p.m. ET. PTAB judges will teach all sessions. Topics include:Tips to file an appeal brief efficientlyHow to make written arguments more persuasiveHow to present an effective oral argument before a judge panelSee the agenda for more information. The event is free and registration is encouraged. The Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow will also take place in Los Angeles, Austin, Atlanta, and Indianapolis. See the full schedule for dates. If you have any questions regarding this event, please email PTABEvents@uspto.gov.CLE credit is pending per state for each roadshow location.
subject: Patent Trial and Appeal Board

title: Trademark Basics Boot Camp, Module 6: Responding to an office action
description: Are you a small business owner or entrepreneur interested in learning about trademarks and how to apply for a federal registration? If so, this event is a must-attend. In this sixth module of our eight-part virtual Trademark Basics Boot Camp, we’ll focus on responding to office actions, the official letters that USPTO examining attorneys issue after reviewing your trademark application. The event is free, but space is limited, so register early.This module will cover the following topics:Trademark basicsOffice action basicsResponse timeframes and deadlinesFiling a responseTips for a successful responseFinding helpThis module will be presented live via Webex from 2-3:30 p.m. ET on Tuesday, May 7, 2024, and will conclude with a question-and-answer session. title: A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a ﬂexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields?	Biology	Biomedical Engineering	Chemistry	Chemical Engineering	Computer Engineering	Computer Science	Design	Electrical Engineering	Mechanical Engineering	Physics 	If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America’s Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on May 15 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.
subject: Events
